author: Shoumojit Banerjee
text:
Ranragini Bhumata Brigade leader Trupti Desai, who spearheaded the campaign to breach the inner sanctum of the Shani Shingnapur temple in Ahmednagar district of Maharashtra, said on Friday that she received death threats through a hate letter.

An anonymous letter, postmarked Ahmednagar, was delivered to the RBB office in the afternoon, warning the activist to cease her agitation or she “would go Dr. Dabholkar’s way,” Ms. Desai said.

Eminent rationalist Narendra Dabholkar was shot dead by two motorcycle-borne assailants in August 20, 2013. After the eerily similar murder of Communist leader Govind Pansare in Kolhapur in February last year, many activists and intellectuals across the State have received threats.
title: Shani temple activist claims she was threatened
